enhanced.title: The New Covenant Begins
enhanced.description: The New Testament reveals the arrival of Jesus and the beginning of a new relationship between God and humanity.

enhanced.title: Structure and Purpose
enhanced.description: Divided into Gospels, Acts, Letters, and Revelation, each part unveils God's plan of salvation through Christ.

enhanced.title: Promise Fulfilled
enhanced.description: Jesus is the fulfillment of all Old Testament promises and prophecies.

sections.label: Quick Quiz
sections.question: What are the four main parts of the New Testament?

sections.label: Think About This
sections.question: What does a 'new covenant' mean to you personally?

scripture.text: This cup is the new covenant in my blood, which is poured out for you.

sections.prompt: Jesus came to offer a new way to relate to God—through grace and faith.
sections.inputPlaceholder: How do you understand the difference between the old and new covenants?

enhanced.title: Matthew – Jesus the King
enhanced.description: Matthew emphasizes Jesus as the promised Messiah and King from the line of David. It focuses on His teachings and kingdom parables.

enhanced.title: Mark – Jesus the Servant
enhanced.description: Mark presents a fast-paced account of Jesus’ actions, highlighting His power, authority, and sacrificial service.

enhanced.title: Luke – Jesus the Savior for All
enhanced.description: Luke focuses on Jesus' compassion, miracles, and ministry to the marginalized—showing salvation is for everyone.

enhanced.title: John – Jesus the Son of God
enhanced.description: John offers a deep, spiritual view of Jesus’ identity as the divine Word, the Light, and the Way to eternal life.

sections.label: Quick Quiz
sections.question: Which Gospel emphasizes Jesus as the Son of God?

sections.label: Think About This
sections.question: Which Gospel account do you connect with the most, and why?

scripture.text: But these are written that you may believe that Jesus is the Messiah, the Son of God...

sections.prompt: Each Gospel offers a unique view of Jesus. Explore how they complement each other.
sections.inputPlaceholder: Which perspective of Jesus stands out to you?

enhanced.title: Son of God
enhanced.description: Jesus is the promised Messiah, fully divine and fully human, who came to save us.

enhanced.title: Teacher and Healer
enhanced.description: He healed the sick, calmed storms, and taught with unmatched wisdom and authority.

enhanced.title: The Cross and Resurrection
enhanced.description: Jesus died for our sins and rose again, defeating death and offering eternal life.

sections.label: Quick Quiz
sections.question: Which Gospel begins with a genealogy of Jesus?

enhanced.title: The Spirit Comes
enhanced.description: In Acts 2, the Holy Spirit empowers the disciples to preach and perform miracles.

enhanced.title: Growth Through Trials
enhanced.description: Despite persecution, the church grows rapidly across the Roman Empire.

enhanced.title: The Gospel Spreads
enhanced.description: Missionaries like Paul carry the Gospel far beyond Jerusalem to the Gentile world.

enhanced.title: Letters to the Church
enhanced.description: The apostles wrote letters to instruct, correct, and encourage believers in the early church.

enhanced.title: Living the Faith
enhanced.description: Topics include unity, spiritual gifts, marriage, grace, and perseverance.

enhanced.title: Faith That Works
enhanced.description: James reminds us that faith without action is dead—we’re called to live it out.

enhanced.title: A Vision of the End
enhanced.description: John's vision reveals spiritual realities and the ultimate triumph of Christ.

enhanced.title: The Return of the King
enhanced.description: Jesus will return, evil will be defeated, and believers will reign with Him forever.

enhanced.title: A New Heaven and Earth
enhanced.description: God promises to wipe every tear, end suffering, and restore creation completely.

enhanced.title: From Jesus to the Church
enhanced.description: The New Testament tells the story of Jesus and how His followers shaped the world.

enhanced.description: We are called to live out what we’ve learned—with faith, love, and mission.

enhanced.title: Your Role in the Story
enhanced.description: The story doesn’t end in Revelation. You’re invited to continue it with your life.
